intro: Pauletia rufa, commonly known as the red pauletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Pauletia rufa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance.
